workflow.name: Automated blog creation from news to publication using Gemini, Ideogram & Slack
workflow.description:
The **AI Blog Creator with Gemini, Replicate Image, Supabase Publishing & Slack** is a fully automated content generation and publishing workflow designed for modern marketing and SaaS teams.
It automatically fetches the latest industry trends, generates SEO-optimized blogs using AI, creates a relevant featured image, publishes the post to your CMS (e.g., Supabase or custom API), and notifies your team via Slack all on a daily schedule.

This workflow connects multiple services NewsAPI, Google Gemini, Replicate, Supabase, and Slack into one intelligent content pipeline that runs hands-free once set up.

---

### **‚ú® Features**

* üì∞ **Fetch Trending Topics** ‚Äî pulls the latest news or updates from your selected industry (via NewsAPI).
* ü§ñ **AI Topic Generation** ‚Äî Gemini suggests trending blog topics relevant to AI, SaaS, and Automation.
* üìù **AI Blog Authoring** ‚Äî Gemini then writes a full 1200-1500 word SEO-optimized article in Markdown.
* üßπ **Smart JSON Cleaner** ‚Äî A resilient code node parses Gemini‚Äôs output and ensures clean, structured data.
* üñºÔ∏è **Auto-Generated Image** ‚Äî Replicate‚Äôs Ideogram model creates a blog cover image based on the content prompt.
* üåê **Automatic Publishing** ‚Äî Posts are automatically published to your Supabase or custom backend.
* üí¨ **Slack Notification** ‚Äî Notifies your team with blog details and live URL.
* ‚è∞ **Fully Scheduled** ‚Äî Runs automatically every day at your preferred time (default 10 AM IST).

---

### **‚öôÔ∏è Workflow Structure**

| Step | Node                                | Purpose                                         |
| ---- | ----------------------------------- | ----------------------------------------------- |
| 1    | **Schedule Trigger**                | Runs daily at 10 AM                             |
| 2    | **Fetch Industry Trends (NewsAPI)** | Retrieves trending articles                     |
| 3    | **Message a model (Gemini)**        | Generates trending topic ideas                  |
| 4    | **Message a model1 (Gemini)**       | Writes full SEO blog content                    |
| 5    | **Code in JavaScript**              | Cleans, validates, and normalizes Gemini output |
| 6    | **HTTP Request (Replicate)**        | Generates an image using Ideogram               |
| 7    | **HTTP Request1**                   | Retrieves generated image URL                   |
| 8    | **Wait + If**                       | Polls until image generation succeeds           |
| 9    | **Edit Fields**                     | Assembles blog fields into final JSON           |
| 10   | **Publish to Supabase**             | Posts to your CMS                               |
| 11   | **Slack Notification**              | Sends message to your Slack channel             |

---

### **üîß Setup Instructions**

1. **Import the Workflow** in n8n and enable it.
2. Create the following credentials:

   * **NewsAPI (Query Auth)** ‚Äî from [https://newsapi.org](https://newsapi.org)
   * **Google Gemini (PaLM API)** ‚Äî use your Gemini API key
   * **Replicate (Bearer Auth)** ‚Äî API key from [https://replicate.com/account](https://replicate.com/account)
   * **Supabase (Header Auth)** ‚Äî endpoint to your `/functions/v1/blog-api` (set your key in header)
   * **Slack API** ‚Äî create a Slack App token with `chat:write` permission
3. Edit the **NewsAPI URL** query parameter to match your industry (e.g., `q=AI automation SaaS`).
4. Update the **Supabase publish URL** to your project endpoint if needed.
5. Adjust the **Slack Channel** name under ‚ÄúSlack Notification‚Äù.
6. (Optional) Change the **Schedule Trigger** time as per your timezone.

---

### **üí° Notes & Tips**

* The **Code in JavaScript** node is robust against malformed or extra text in Gemini output ‚Äî it sanitizes Markdown and reconstructs clean JSON safely.
* You can replace Supabase with any CMS or Webhook endpoint by editing the ‚ÄúPublish to Supabase‚Äù node.
* The Replicate model used is `ideogram-ai/ideogram-v3-turbo` ‚Äî you can swap it with Stable Diffusion or another model for different aesthetics.
* Use the `slug` field in your blog URLs for SEO-friendly links.
* Test with one manual execution before activating scheduled runs.
* If Slack notification fails, verify the token scopes and channel permissions.

---

### **üß© Tags**

`#AI` `#Automation` `#ContentMarketing` `#BlogGenerator` `#n8n` `#Supabase` `#Gemini` `#Replicate` `#Slack` `#WorkflowAutomation`

workflow.name: AI Blog Creator with Gemini, Replicate Image, Supabase Publishing & Slack

values.content:
=Act as an AI market analyst. Based on these current trends and articles:
"{{ $json.articles }}"
Generate 1 trending blog topic ideas relevant to SaaS, AI, Automation, and industry innovation that would benefit our company‚Äôs brand authority.
Return them in strict JSON with fields: title, description, keywords.
no exta text, details etc. give me direct json output without pre and post text.

=You are an expert SEO content strategist. Write a 1200‚Äì1500 word blog in Markdown on the topic:
"{{ $json.content.parts[0].text }}"

Requirements:
- Use high-ranking keywords naturally.
- Include an SEO title, meta description, and excerpt.
- Use markdown headings, bullet points, and bold keywords.
- Structure: Introduction ‚Üí Insight ‚Üí Case Studies ‚Üí Conclusion ‚Üí CTA.
Output JSON:
{
  "title": "...",
  "slug": "...",
  "excerpt": "...",
  "content": "...",
  "keywords": "...",
  "image_prompt": "..."
}

parameters.jsonOutput:
={
  "title": "{{ $('Code in JavaScript').item.json.title }}",
  "slug": "{{ $('Code in JavaScript').item.json.slug }}",
  "excerpt": "{{ $('Code in JavaScript').item.json.excerpt }}",
  "content": "{{ $('Code in JavaScript').item.json.content }}",
  "image_url": "{{ $json.output }}",
  "published": true
}

parameters.content:
### üåê **Fetch Industry Trends (HTTP Request ‚Äì NewsAPI)**

**Purpose:**
Fetches the latest 10 articles related to ‚ÄúAI automation SaaS‚Äù from NewsAPI.
These articles are used as context for generating trending blog topics.

**Credentials Required:**

* `NewsAPI` (Generic Query Auth) ‚Äî Use your API key from [https://newsapi.org](https://newsapi.org).

**Notes:**

* You can modify the `q` parameter to match your industry (e.g., ‚Äúfinance AI,‚Äù ‚Äúhealthcare automation,‚Äù etc.).
* You can also adjust `pageSize` to fetch more or fewer results.
* NewsAPI free tier allows 100 requests/day ‚Äî plan accordingly if running multiple times.

### ü§ñ **Message a model (Google Gemini)**

**Purpose:**
Asks Gemini to analyze current news trends and generate **1 trending blog topic** idea in JSON format (title, description, keywords).

**Credentials Required:**

* `Google Gemini (PaLM) API Key`

**Notes:**

* Returns strict JSON to make downstream parsing easier.
* You can modify the prompt for your own industry context (e.g., ‚ÄúBased on fintech trends‚Ä¶‚Äù).
* Recommended model: `gemini-2.5-flash` for faster responses.

### ‚úçÔ∏è **Message a model1 (Google Gemini)**

**Purpose:**
Generates a full-length blog (1200‚Äì1500 words) on the selected topic, optimized for SEO and structured in Markdown.

**Credentials Required:**

* Same `Google Gemini (PaLM)` credential as above.

**Notes:**

* The prompt includes explicit instructions for SEO title, meta description, excerpt, and structured JSON output.
* You can tune word length or format (e.g., shorter LinkedIn post version) by editing the prompt text.
* Output is JSON, but sometimes Gemini may include Markdown or text noise ‚Äî the next node handles cleanup.

### üßπ **Code in JavaScript**

**Purpose:**
Cleans, parses, and repairs any messy AI output to ensure consistent JSON fields (title, slug, excerpt, content, keywords, image_prompt).

**Notes:**

* This code is **resilient** against broken Markdown, mixed quotes, and malformed JSON.
* It automatically normalizes the slug, removes extra quotation marks, and trims long text.
* If Gemini output fails to parse, it still produces fallback fields like `Untitled Blog`.
* No credentials required.

üí° *You can safely modify this node if you add or remove output fields from the AI prompt.*

### üñºÔ∏è **HTTP Request (Replicate ‚Äì Generate Image)**

**Purpose:**
Sends the `image_prompt` field to Replicate‚Äôs **Ideogram v3 Turbo** model to generate a 1024√ó1024 image.

**Credentials Required:**

* `Replicate Bearer YOUR_TOKEN_HERE` from [https://replicate.com/account](https://replicate.com/account)

**Notes:**

* Modify `width`/`height` for other image sizes.
* You can swap model endpoint with any text-to-image API you prefer.
* Returns a `prediction ID` and temporary URL for polling.

### ‚è±Ô∏è **Wait**

**Purpose:**
Adds a 20-second delay before rechecking Replicate‚Äôs image status.

**Notes:**

* Replicate image generation takes ~10‚Äì20 seconds usually.
* You can increase or decrease the wait time depending on your model speed.
* Prevents rate-limit errors by spacing out API calls.

### ‚è≥ **HTTP Request1 (Replicate Polling)**

**Purpose:**
Fetches the status of the image generation request from Replicate using the returned `prediction ID`.

**Credentials Required:**

* Same Replicate Bearer YOUR_TOKEN_HERE as above.

**Notes:**

* The polling is used in combination with the **Wait** and **If** nodes.
* Returns `status` = `succeeded` once image is ready.
* You can also extract error messages if the job fails.

### ‚úÖ **If**

**Purpose:**
Checks if the Replicate image generation has **succeeded**.

**Notes:**

* If the status = ‚Äúsucceeded,‚Äù workflow proceeds to the next step.
* If not, it loops back to **HTTP Request1** to poll again.
* This ensures the workflow doesn‚Äôt break while waiting for long image generations.

### üß© **Edit Fields (Set Node)**

**Purpose:**
Combines cleaned text and generated image URL into a final JSON payload for publishing.

**Notes:**

* Merges `title`, `slug`, `excerpt`, `content`, and `image_url` fields into one structured object.
* Adds `"published": true` flag for Supabase insert.
* You can add extra custom fields like `category` or `author` here easily.

### üöÄ **Publish to Supabase (HTTP Request)**

**Purpose:**
Publishes the final blog post to Supabase via your custom function endpoint.

**Credentials Required:**

* `Supabase Header Auth` (e.g., `Authorization: Bearer YOUR_TOKEN_HERE`)

**Notes:**

* The example endpoint is:

  ```
  https://your-project.supabase.co/functions/v1/blog-api
  ```
* Make sure your Supabase Edge Function expects JSON with the fields provided.
* You can replace this with your own CMS (WordPress, Ghost, Webflow, etc.) API endpoint.

### üí¨ **Slack Notification**

**Purpose:**
Notifies your Slack channel with the published blog details.

**Credentials Required:**

* Slack API token (with `chat:write` permission).

**Notes:**

* Message includes blog title, slug, and URL (`https://utsltech.com/blog/{{slug}}`).
* You can customize channel name and message formatting (supports Block Kit).
* Great for instant visibility of published content.

## üß© General Notes for Template

* **All credentials** should be created before importing the workflow.
* **Error handling:** This workflow includes a fallback for Gemini output; you can add a global error workflow for API failures.
* **Customization:** You can easily extend the flow to auto-share to LinkedIn, Twitter, or email subscribers.
* **Runtime:** Average runtime ~1‚Äì2 minutes depending on image generation time.
* **Timezone:** Set to `Asia/Kolkata` by default ‚Äî adjust if needed in workflow settings.

The **AI Blog Creator with Gemini, Replicate Image, Supabase Publishing & Slack** is a fully automated content generation and publishing workflow designed for modern marketing and SaaS teams.
It automatically fetches the latest industry trends, generates SEO-optimized blogs using AI, creates a relevant featured image, publishes the post to your CMS (e.g., Supabase or custom API), and notifies your team via Slack all on a daily schedule.

This workflow connects multiple services NewsAPI, Google Gemini, Replicate, Supabase, and Slack into one intelligent content pipeline that runs hands-free once set up.

---

### **‚ú® Features**

* üì∞ **Fetch Trending Topics** ‚Äî pulls the latest news or updates from your selected industry (via NewsAPI).
* ü§ñ **AI Topic Generation** ‚Äî Gemini suggests trending blog topics relevant to AI, SaaS, and Automation.
* üìù **AI Blog Authoring** ‚Äî Gemini then writes a full 1200-1500 word SEO-optimized article in Markdown.
* üßπ **Smart JSON Cleaner** ‚Äî A resilient code node parses Gemini‚Äôs output and ensures clean, structured data.
* üñºÔ∏è **Auto-Generated Image** ‚Äî Replicate‚Äôs Ideogram model creates a blog cover image based on the content prompt.
* üåê **Automatic Publishing** ‚Äî Posts are automatically published to your Supabase or custom backend.
* üí¨ **Slack Notification** ‚Äî Notifies your team with blog details and live URL.
* ‚è∞ **Fully Scheduled** ‚Äî Runs automatically every day at your preferred time (default 10 AM IST).

---

### **‚öôÔ∏è Workflow Structure**

| Step | Node                                | Purpose                                         |
| ---- | ----------------------------------- | ----------------------------------------------- |
| 1    | **Schedule Trigger**                | Runs daily at 10 AM                             |
| 2    | **Fetch Industry Trends (NewsAPI)** | Retrieves trending articles                     |
| 3    | **Message a model (Gemini)**        | Generates trending topic ideas                  |
| 4    | **Message a model1 (Gemini)**       | Writes full SEO blog content                    |
| 5    | **Code in JavaScript**              | Cleans, validates, and normalizes Gemini output |
| 6    | **HTTP Request (Replicate)**        | Generates an image using Ideogram               |
| 7    | **HTTP Request1**                   | Retrieves generated image URL                   |
| 8    | **Wait + If**                       | Polls until image generation succeeds           |
| 9    | **Edit Fields**                     | Assembles blog fields into final JSON           |
| 10   | **Publish to Supabase**             | Posts to your CMS                               |
| 11   | **Slack Notification**              | Sends message to your Slack channel             |

---

### **üîß Setup Instructions**

1. **Import the Workflow** in n8n and enable it.
2. Create the following credentials:

   * **NewsAPI (Query Auth)** ‚Äî from [https://newsapi.org](https://newsapi.org)
   * **Google Gemini (PaLM API)** ‚Äî use your Gemini API key
   * **Replicate (Bearer YOUR_TOKEN_HERE)** ‚Äî API key from [https://replicate.com/account](https://replicate.com/account)
   * **Supabase (Header Auth)** ‚Äî endpoint to your `/functions/v1/blog-api` (set your key in header)
   * **Slack API** ‚Äî create a Slack App token with `chat:write` permission
3. Edit the **NewsAPI URL** query parameter to match your industry (e.g., `q=AI automation SaaS`).
4. Update the **Supabase publish URL** to your project endpoint if needed.
5. Adjust the **Slack Channel** name under ‚ÄúSlack Notification‚Äù.
6. (Optional) Change the **Schedule Trigger** time as per your timezone.

---

### **üí° Notes & Tips**

* The **Code in JavaScript** node is robust against malformed or extra text in Gemini output ‚Äî it sanitizes Markdown and reconstructs clean JSON safely.
* You can replace Supabase with any CMS or Webhook endpoint by editing the ‚ÄúPublish to Supabase‚Äù node.
* The Replicate model used is `ideogram-ai/ideogram-v3-turbo` ‚Äî you can swap it with Stable Diffusion or another model for different aesthetics.
* Use the `slug` field in your blog URLs for SEO-friendly links.
* Test with one manual execution before activating scheduled runs.
* If Slack notification fails, verify the token scopes and channel permissions.

user.name: Parag Javale
user.bio: Tech driven creative who turns ideas into impact. I blend storytelling, product strategy, and automation whether it‚Äôs hooky audio promos, smart LMS platforms, or AI driven workflows. I help businesses grab attention, streamline ops, and scale fast. Big on data, experiments, and building digital solutions that actually work.

data.details: The Cron node uses Cron under the hood - a time-based job scheduler in Unix-like computer operating systems. Use this node when you want to trigger workflows periodically, especially in more complex scenarios like "every Tuesday at 9 am" or "Weekdays".

data.details:
The IF node can be used to implement binary conditional logic in your workflow. You can set up one-to-many conditions to evaluate each item of data being inputted into the node. That data will either evaluate to TRUE or FALSE and route out of the node accordingly.

This node has multiple types of conditions: Bool, String, Number, and Date & Time.

data.details: The Code node allows you to execute JavaScript in your workflow.
